overview: A tech-geek and hacker who loves spending nights building new technologies and solutions, often just to see if something can be done. As a first serious undertaking, built a discussion board software for feature-phones in 2004 and thus founded one of the first successful Lithuanian WAP communities. Built WapAmp in early 2005 - one of the first mobile site builders in the world. Launched numerous passion-projects since then, some of them being more successful than others. Some of the more prominent ones: Diferior.com - an open-source CMS. XtFramework (@Github) - a MIT-licensed PHP framework built for speed and scalability. wq.lt - basic URL shortener service with support for mobile browsers and generating phone-keyboard-entry-friendly short links. XtBoard - a spiritual successor to the WAP-era discussion board service - powerful mobile community software. Launched XtGem at the end of 2006, worked on constantly adding new features, growing user-base, managing a (small) server cluster and it’s architecture, scaled the technology and grew the service to a 1m users before hiring any outside help.
